xwikidoc.title: IRC Archive for channel #ccm on 15 April 2013
xwikidoc.content: <froggy> has joined #ccm 02:50 <Natasha> has joined #ccm 03:38 <aciid> has joined #ccm 04:31 <ravigarg27> has joined #ccm 05:04 <froggy> has joined #ccm 06:56 <aciid> has joined #ccm 07:43 <froggy> has joined #ccm 09:16 <froggy> has joined #ccm 09:40 <aciid> has joined #ccm 09:58 <ravigarg27> has joined #ccm 10:08 <froggy> has joined #ccm 10:21 <ishaan> has joined #ccm 11:04 <Krinye> has joined #ccm 11:05 <Krinye> Hello wondering if anyone could help me again with questions about project timelines 11:05 <sdumitriu> Hi Krinye 11:06 <Krinye> Hi sdmitriu, I have been trying to get more detailed information, other than the wiki, but mark hasn't set me the documents yet 11:07 <Krinye> I do not know what items to place on my timeline, at this point I am not sure if we are needed to generalize timelines or get into specifics 11:07 <Krinye> I am kind of worried because the deadline is coming up and I still have to make time for exams and stuff 11:08 <sdumitriu> The deadline isn't coming so soon 11:08 <sdumitriu> The student registration didn't even start yet 11:09 <Krinye> I applied last year and they really want the timelines to be specific. 11:10 <sdumitriu> Well, that varies from organization to organization 11:10 <Krinye> Although the registration is not yet here yet, I have to draft a proposal and have it critiqued before sending it in 11:10 <sdumitriu> I know that timelines aren't something to be counted upon 11:10 <sdumitriu> What's more important is seeing how much you understand what needs to be done 11:11 <sdumitriu> I'll talk with Marc later today 11:12 <Krinye> that would be great, is it possible to drop by the centre and talk to someone, get more info? 11:13 <sdumitriu> Not to the CCM, since it's tougher security, but by the lab 11:14 <sdumitriu> Pratt Bldg, Room 286 11:14 <sdumitriu> You know where that is? 11:15 <Krinye> near convocation hall front campus? 11:17 <sdumitriu> http://goo.gl/maps/YvpYk 11:18 <sdumitriu> Second floor 11:18 <sdumitriu> Right in front of the stairs 11:18 <sdumitriu> I'm not there yet, will be after 2 11:20 <Krinye> thanks I will make it there today. Thanks 11:21 <aciid> has joined #ccm 11:26 <Anuja> has joined #ccm 11:27 <Anuja> Hi 11:30 <sdumitriu> Hi Anuja 11:31 <Anuja> I am interested in working on the project - Visualization and analysis of patient data for the diagnosis of genetic disorders 11:31 <Anuja> I have some doubts regarding it 11:32 <sdumitriu> OK 11:32 <Anuja> Is it a right time to ask ? 11:34 <sdumitriu> Yes 11:35 <aciid> hi 11:35 <Anuja> What methods will be considered from retrieving patients with similar manfestations? 11:35 <aciid> I am interested in making iOS app 11:36 <aciid> i sent a mail to vcell-discuss@googlegroups.com but no reply :( 11:36 <Anuja> Example - One way i can think is, if each patient is represented by a vector of attribute than cosine similarity can be used for finding similar patients 11:36 <Anuja> like how its dont in recommendation systems 11:36 <Anuja> *done 11:37 <sdumitriu> aciid: We're not affiliated with vcell 11:37 <aciid> Oh 11:37 <aciid> do you know how do i contact them? 11:38 <sdumitriu> They're part of NRNB 11:38 <aciid> do they have an irc channel? 11:40 <sdumitriu> vcell-discuss seems to be the right channel 11:40 <sdumitriu> So you should wait some more for a reply 11:40 <sdumitriu> When did you contact them? 11:40 <aciid> some 3 days ago 11:40 <sdumitriu> It's been a weekend, wait until tomorrow 11:40 <sdumitriu> If still no answer, write a follow-up email 11:41 <aciid> okay 11:41 <aciid> thank you :) 11:41 <froggy> I have some queries related to savant android version 11:41 <sdumitriu> You're welcome 11:41 <sdumitriu> froggy: Hold on, I still have to answer Anuja 11:41 <froggy> ok go on 11:42 <sdumitriu> Anuja: Yes, patients already have a list of phenotypes, and other observations 11:42 <sdumitriu> So indeed the goal is to select other patients with similar phenotypes 11:43 <sdumitriu> How exactly to measure the similarity is something to analyze together with the mentors 11:43 <sdumitriu> So one goal of the project is to find a good measure 11:44 <sdumitriu> The other goal is to make a nice UI for exploring the patients network 11:44 <aciid> has left #ccm 11:45 <Anuja> I have experience in Hibernate, Tomcat, Struts 11:45 <Anuja> I need to brush up javascript and CSS though 11:46 <Anuja> Also will it involve clustering algorithms? 11:47 <sdumitriu> Probably yes 11:48 <Anuja> okay thanks :) 11:48 <Anuja> Can you also tell what is expected from the mentee and a project proposal ? 11:49 <Anuja> Also will the main focus be on UI or on the algorithms being used. I can learn advance UI stuff in case needed 11:54 <sdumitriu> Both 11:55 <sdumitriu> But any of these done well is good enough 11:57 <Anuja> Ok cool, Thanks a ton :) . Will bother you in case of any further doubts 12:01 <froggy> sdumitriu: ping 12:01 <sdumitriu> Pong 12:01 <froggy> :P 13:24 <froggy> has joined #ccm 13:53 <sdumitriu1> has joined #ccm 14:30 <sdumitriu1> Hey froggy, did you get in touch with Marc? 14:31 <froggy> no, his nick ? 14:31 <sdumitriu1> Not here, let me fetch him 14:31 <froggy> i did send a mail . ok do that 14:38 <mfiume> has joined #ccm 14:39 <mfiume> Hi froggy, what's up? 14:39 <froggy> hi, so You marc 14:39 <mfiume> Yes I am :) 14:41 <froggy> so i have a query for the savant android version 14:41 <froggy> do you have an api for it ? ie for the android client 14:42 <froggy> what sort of data are we talking about which is to be parsed in the android client 14:42 <mfiume> no, the project will involve creating an API from the existing Java platform 14:42 <mfiume> the data is genomics data 14:43 <mfiume> the API should communicate via JSON elements 14:43 <froggy> a rest api / 14:43 <froggy> ? 14:43 <mfiume> preferrably 14:44 <froggy> man ! Its sad then . I came for android client . I know how to deal with api from android but i am inexperinced in creating apis 14:47 <mfiume> Unfortunately this project will involve creating an API 14:56 <froggy> ok ! maybe i will come next year after the api is completed to consume it through my android client 14:56 <froggy> :) 14:57 <sdumitriu1> Hey froggy, there's https://gsoc.ccm.sickkids.ca/GoogleSummerOfCode/Mobile+UI+for+the+Pedigree+tool 14:57 <froggy> wait . how did i miss that ! lemme see 15:07 <froggy> has left #ccm 15:10 <froggy> has joined #ccm 15:20 <froggy> hi sdumitriu1 , went through the idea . 15:20 <froggy> so where can i learn more about pedigree 15:21 <froggy> where is the code for the pedigree web app ? 15:22 <froggy> so basically , the idea is to implement the pedigree tool in android ? 15:23 <qwebirc85263> has joined #ccm 15:23 <sdumitriu1> You can see a demo at http://phenotips.org/edit/data/P0000016?sheet=PhenoTips.PedigreeEditor# 15:23 <sdumitriu1> Nope, discard that link, it's broken 15:23 <sdumitriu1> http://phenotips.org/data/ 15:23 <sdumitriu1> Click on New patient record 15:24 <sdumitriu1> And in the Family History section, click on Draw Pedigree 15:24 <sdumitriu1> The code is in https://github.com/compbio-UofT/phenotips/tree/master/pedigree 15:26 <froggy> unable to click on new patient record 15:27 <froggy> no onclick listener :P 15:27 <sdumitriu1> That's normal, there should never be onclick listeners in a good web page 15:27 <sdumitriu1> It's supposed to be a link 15:27 <sdumitriu1> Nope, not a link, a form submit button 15:28 <froggy> yes i was kidding . Its not working 15:28 <sdumitriu1> Ah, I see 15:28 <froggy> ie the link 15:28 <sdumitriu1> That button... 15:28 <sdumitriu1> There was supposed to be another one at the bottom, but it's not there anymore... 15:29 <froggy> i edited a patient record 15:29 <froggy> now i am inside a record 15:30 <froggy> ok got it 15:31 <froggy> so viewing the pedigree o/p 15:34 <froggy> so the form data creates the pedigree output ? 15:36 <froggy> Android has opengl es libs to help draw shapes accorcing to inputs in a form . 15:37 <froggy> ie . it can work on the same lines as pedigree if that is the working principle 15:37 <sdumitriu1> We'd like to have this not as a native application, but as a web app 15:37 <sdumitriu1> HTML+JS+CSS+SVG 15:38 <froggy> but pedigree is already a web app i guess 15:38 <sdumitriu1> So most of the app already exists, what it needs is to make it work with touch events instead of onclick and onmouseover 15:38 <froggy> i am viewing it in a browser right now 15:38 <sdumitriu1> (which don't exist on mobile devices) 15:39 <froggy> o i get it 15:40 <froggy> Ok i get it ! You want it to be used in the browser of the mobile device ? Yes it can be done . But you can always create native android/ios app for it ? 16:00 <sdumitriu1> froggy: The new patient record button should work now 16:01 <froggy> ok . i just had to view the pedigree tool once . already did that 16:23 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 16:35 <sdumitriu> Hi kushalkhandelwal 16:38 <kushalkhandelwal> Hi sdumitriu 16:39 <sdumitriu> Were you looking for the mentors? 16:39 <kushalkhandelwal> Yes I am looking 16:39 <kushalkhandelwal> Can you tell me more about " Real-time collection of clinical data on patients with genetic disorders using various medical ontologies" 16:39 <kushalkhandelwal> this idea 16:40 <kushalkhandelwal> how should I go about it 16:41 <kushalkhandelwal> sdumitriu, ? 16:46 <sdumitriu> Just so I know where to start explaining, did you take a look at PhenoTips? Did you understand what it does? 16:52 <kushalkhandelwal> Yes , I had a look at phenotips and have a gist of what it does 16:53 <kushalkhandelwal> sorry for the frequent disconnection , some power failure issues at my university 16:53 <kushalkhandelwal> From what I understand , it collects and analyzes the patient data 16:54 <kushalkhandelwal> it suggests clinical investigations 16:54 <kushalkhandelwal> helps in diagnosis 16:54 <sdumitriu> Yep 16:55 <sdumitriu> So, the most important part is the patient's phenotipic description, all the symptomps observed 16:56 <sdumitriu> And in order to have this data in a reusable manner, it is stored not as free text, but as terms from an ontology 16:56 <kushalkhandelwal> So one challenge is to accurately record the symptoms observed 16:56 <sdumitriu> "Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder" is stored as HP:0007018 16:57 <sdumitriu> Now, while we like HPO because it's open, it's easy to improve, and so far it's pretty comprehensive, most existing applications use other standards 16:57 <sdumitriu> Most of the hospital where we deployed PhenoTips asked about ICD9, ICD10 or LDD 16:57 <sdumitriu> So the goal is to do the same thing that's happening now, but instead of using terms from HPO, use terms from ICD10 or LDD 16:58 <sdumitriu> The administrator should be able to chose among the available ontologies 16:58 <kushalkhandelwal> Ok , so we need to find the links in HPO and ICD10 and map them 16:59 <kushalkhandelwal> As I know from what i have heard around from doctors , ICD is the most common classification 17:15 <kushalkhandelwal> sdumitriu, ? 17:16 <sdumitriu> kushalkhandelwal: That's not the goal of the project, since it probably requires a lot of work 17:16 <sdumitriu> (there are 10.000 terms in HPO, and much more in ICD) 17:17 <sdumitriu> How it works right now is that the HPO is indexed in a Solr server 17:17 <kushalkhandelwal> ok 17:17 <sdumitriu> And when the user searches for something using free text, the best matches from the Solr index are retrieved and display 17:18 <sdumitriu> HPO has not just an ID, but also a name and a description of each term 17:19 <sdumitriu> So we match doctor's words agains the name and the description, and while we display the Name field to the user, we store the ID field in the database 17:19 <sdumitriu> So, the goal is to do the same for ICD10 17:19 <sdumitriu> Since terms in ICD10 also have identifier, name and description 17:20 <sdumitriu> So instead of searching in the indexed HPO, we search in the indexed ICD ontology and store terms from it 17:21 <kushalkhandelwal> Ok , so we have an option to chose from available ontologies 17:21 <sdumitriu> Yes 17:21 <kushalkhandelwal> use ICD10 or HPO 17:21 <sdumitriu> The main problem after that is that existing patient records won't be updated automatically 17:21 <sdumitriu> This is where the mapping between ontologies would be helpful 17:22 <sdumitriu> But it's outside the scope of this project 17:22 <sdumitriu> So you don't have to worry about that 17:23 <kushalkhandelwal> So we don't have to update the current records 17:23 <kushalkhandelwal> and only implement the new ontology for new patients 17:23 <sdumitriu> Yes 17:26 <kushalkhandelwal> So the goal of the project would be to provide an interface to chose between available ontologies , Index the new ontology 17:27 <sdumitriu> Yes 17:29 <kushalkhandelwal> So I have forked the code , would go through the codebase 17:29 <kushalkhandelwal> I know a little bit about Solr , so need to know more about it 17:33 <vshivam> has joined #ccm 18:08 <kushalkhandelwal> sdumitriu, 18:08 <kushalkhandelwal> An initial draft for my application : http://goo.gl/W59hO 18:34 <kushalkhandelwal> timepass 18:35 <kushalkhandelwal> hackernews article padh raha hoon ab 18:35 <kushalkhandelwal> ab simplecv pe teko maarte we dekhne aa raha hoon 18:39 <marius> has joined #ccm 18:59 <sdumitriu> kushalkhandelwal: Sorry, I'm unavailable at the moment, I'll be back in about an hour 19:12 <hellboy2k8> has joined #ccm 19:44 <vshivam> has joined #ccm 19:58 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 20:24 <hellboy2k8> has joined #ccm 21:28 <froggy> has joined #ccm 22:45 <vshivam> has joined #ccm 23:47 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 23:52 <froggy> has joined #ccm
